title: Fukuoka SoftBank Hawks win the 2025 Japan Series
summary: In baseball, the Fukuoka SoftBank Hawks defeat the Hanshin Tigers to win the Japan Series (MVP Hotaka Yamakawa).

title: Hurricane Melissa leaves more than 40 dead across the Caribbean
summary: Hurricane Melissa's impacts result in dozens of deaths across several Caribbean nations.

title: Over 120 killed in Rio de Janeiro police operation
summary: In Brazil, a large-scale police operation in Rio de Janeiro leaves more than 120 people dead.

title: Massacres reported in Al-Fashir after RSF capture
summary: In Sudan, at least 2,500 people are killed in massacres after Al-Fashir is captured by the Rapid Support Forces.

title: Timor-Leste joins ASEAN as the 11th member
summary: Timor-Leste accedes to the Association of Southeast Asian Nations, becoming its eleventh member state.

title: Kenya landslide kills at least 13 in Rift Valley Province
summary: A landslide triggered by heavy rain kills at least 13 people in western Kenya; more remain missing.

title: Nine killed in stampede at Hindu temple in Andhra Pradesh, India
summary: A stampede at a Hindu temple in Srikakulam kills nine and injures several others.

title: Tanzania election: President Samia Suluhu Hassan declared winner
summary: Tanzania's incumbent president Samia Suluhu Hassan is declared the winner amid opposition protests.

title: UN backs U.S.-supported resolution on Western Sahara autonomy
summary: The UN Security Council approves a resolution supporting Morocco's autonomy proposal for Western Sahara, despite opposition from Algeria.

title: Papua New Guinea landslides kill at least 21 in Enga Province
summary: Landslides in Enga Province, Papua New Guinea, leave at least 21 dead; recovery efforts continue.
